missionProperties.missionInfo:
{-} Neutral mission tokens represent protesters. A hero can interact with a protester to claim it. Then, that hero may test {J}. If he succeeds, he gains 2 movement points.
{-} A figure can attack a protester (Health: 5, Defense: None). If a protester is defeated, the Empire claims it. 
{-} When the mission progresses, threat is increased by the number of protesters the Empire claimed.
{-} At the start of each Status Phase, if either the Rebels or the Empire controls a protester, that side claims that protester.
{-} The mission will progress at the start of the Status Phase if <color="red">Maul</color> and Zaaryn are both defeated.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

globalEvents.name: Open Crate 1
globalEvents.eventText:
You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

entityProperties.name: Crate1
entityProperties.theText: An old supply crate.

entityProperties.theText: An old supply crate.

globalEvents.name: Mission Briefing
globalEvents.eventText:
“Your reputation precedes you, Maul,” Zaaryn says in the transmission you intercepted. “I am willing to deal, but you must do something for me first to prove your good faith. Help me quash this unrest, and then we'll talk."

You arrive at the meeting coordinates provided in the transmission to find civilians gathered for a protest in the streets.

entityProperties.name: Protester 1
entityProperties.theText:
The protesters panick under the Imperial onslaught.

{-} A hero can interact with a protester to rescue and claim it. Then, that hero may test {J}. If he succeeds, he gains 2 movement points.
{-} A figure can attack a protester (Health: 5, Defense: None). If a protester is defeated, the Empire claims it.

entityProperties.name: Protester 2
entityProperties.theText:

eventActions.theText:
{-} Neutral mission tokens represent protesters. A hero can interact with a protester to rescue and claim it. Then, that hero may test {J}. If he succeeds, he gains 2 movement points.
{-} A figure can attack a protester (Health: 5, Defense: None). If a protester is defeated, the Empire claims it. 
{-} When the mission progresses, threat is increased by the number of protesters the Empire claimed.
{-} At the start of each Status Phase, if either the Rebels or the Empire controls a protester, that side claims that protester.
Zaaryn and his complement of troops, with the vicious aid of Maul, are violently breaking up the protest, arresting and even killing its members.

You seize your opportunity and dive into the fray toward your targets. As you approach, the protesters continue to flee into the streets and sewers in search of safety, screaming for someone to save them.

{-} Deploy the heroes to the blue highlighted space.
Rescue the protesters. Defeat <color="red">Maul</color> and Zaaryn. (Rebels: &Rebel claims&; Empire: &Empire claims&)

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels win
globalEvents.eventText:
You blast open the secret entrance to the hideaway. You find neither Zaaryn nor Maul inside, but you do find records of their negotiations and transactions. You find a small sample of information about the Bardottan sphere shard that Zaaryn gave Maul to prove he had something of value. With an expert to translate it, this sample might be enough to lead you to the location of the shard. Alternatively, locating Maul and Zaaryn could provide the rest of the information Zaaryn has.

{-} The Rebels win the mission!
{-} Each hero receives 2 XP. Heroes receive 175 credits per hero.
{-} The heroes must choose to reach out to Lorn (the Jedi historian) or to track Maul and Zaaryn. If the heroes reach out to Lorn, place Story Mission card “History Repeats” into play, If the heroes track Maul and Zaaryn, place Story Mission card “On the Run” into play.

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels lose
globalEvents.eventText:
You are lost, confused, and beaten down by various Imperial and mercenary support troops. You reach out on your comlink to your team members to retreat to a rendezvous point, resigned to reaching the artifact yourself before Maul and Zaaryn's plans can unfold.

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.
{-} The Imperial player earns <color="red">Maul</color> (Seeker of Vengeance) as a villain.
{-} Each hero receives 2 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

globalEvents.name: Reveal Hideaway
globalEvents.eventText: The door opens to reveal a hidden safehouse with a central terminal containing data and records.

entityProperties.name: Hideaway Door 1
entityProperties.theText:
A closed door leads to some hidden place.

{-} When a Rebel figure enters a space adjacent to a door, if the heroes have collectively claimed 5 or more clues, open that door.

entityProperties.name: Hideaway Door 2
entityProperties.theText:
A closed door leads to some hidden place.

{-} When a Rebel figure enters a space adjacent to a door, if the heroes have collectively claimed 5 or more clues, open that door.

eventActions.theText: Two guards immediately ready their weapons.

{-} If the <color="red">Riot Troopers</color> are defeated, a healthy hero can interact with the terminal to sabotage the Hideaway.
{-} The Rebels win when the terminal is sabotaged.

{-} If the <color="red">Riot Troopers</color> are defeated, a healthy hero can interact with the terminal to sabotage the Hideaway.
{-} The Rebels win when the terminal is sabotaged.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

entityProperties.name: Reveal Platform 1
entityProperties.theText:
The narrow, dimly lit streets of Coruscant's lower levels, together with the panicking crowd, makes it hard to make out what lies ahead.

{-} When a Rebel figure enters a space adjacent to an obscured tile, click "Reveal" to reveal the next tile.

globalEvents.name: Protester Rebels 1
globalEvents.eventText:
You quickly hustle the protester to safety.

{-} Claim that token. Then, you may test {J}. If you succeed, you gain 2 movement points.

entityProperties.name: Protester 1
entityProperties.theText:
The protesters panick under the Imperial onslaught.

{-} A hero can interact with a protester to rescue and claim it. Then, that hero may test {J}. If he succeeds, he gains 2 movement points.
{-} A figure can attack a protester (Health: 5, Defense: None). If a protester is defeated, the Empire claims it.

globalEvents.name: Protester Empire 1
globalEvents.eventText:
Imperial soldiers overwhelm the fleeing protester. You have no idea whether they are dead or alive.

{-} The Empire claims that token.

{-} A hero can interact with a protester to rescue and claim it. Then, that hero may test {J}. If he succeeds, he gains 2 movement points.
{-} A figure can attack a protester (Health: 5, Defense: None). If a protester is defeated, the Empire claims it.

globalEvents.name: Protests continue
globalEvents.eventText: As the conflict between protesters and Imperial forces grows fiercer, more and more people join the protesters. Additional security is dispatched to deal with them.

entityProperties.name: Protester 7
entityProperties.theText:
New protesters are met with violent force by the Imperials.

{-} A hero can interact with a protester to rescue and claim it. Then, that hero may test {J}. If he succeeds, he gains 2 movement points.
{-} A figure can attack a protester (Health: 5, Defense: None). If a protester is defeated, the Empire claims it.

globalEvents.name: Splitting Up
globalEvents.eventText: Your targets desperately drop through the cars flying beneath you and land in the lower alleys of the city.

eventActions.theText: You follow them down and find the carnage Maul left behind to cover their escape.
Pedestrians are screaming and running about, a vehicle is overturned, crumbled rocks and metal pulled from surrounding buildings by Maul's Force powers lie strewn about.

entityProperties.name: Overturned Speeder
entityProperties.theText:
The overturned speeder blocks the way.

{-} The Imperial mission token is blocking terrain.

eventActions.theText:
The overturned speeder blocks the way.

{-} The red Imperial mission token is blocking terrain.

entityProperties.name: Rubble 1
entityProperties.theText:
Rubble from the buildings is making it hard to walk here.

{-} Place 1 rubble token on each grean highlighted space.

entityProperties.name: Rubble 2
entityProperties.theText:
Rubble from the buildings is making it hard to walk here.

{-} Place 1 rubble token on each grean highlighted space.

eventActions.theText:
Rubble from the buildings is making it hard to walk here.

{-} Place 1 rubble token on each green highlighted space.

entityProperties.name: Yellow DP UW 1
entityProperties.theText: Place the Imperial figures evenly divided between the two yellow highlighted spaces.

entityProperties.name: Yellow DP UW 2
entityProperties.theText: Place the Imperial figures evenly divided between the two yellow highlighted spaces.

eventActions.theText:
Your enemies have followed you down, although they look a little battered by the ordeal.

{-} Place all Imperial figures divided evenly between the yellow points. Each Imperial figure without “Mobile” suffers 1 {C}.

Looking around, you can't tell which way they went, so you instantly begin the hunt.

{-} Place the heroes as close as possible to the blue highlighted space.
{-} Tiles not yet placed in the map are obscured tiles.
{-} When a Rebel figure enters a space that would be adjacent to a space on an obscured tile, click the respective highlight and select "Reveal".
{-} Rebel mission tokens represent clues. A hero can spend 1 movement point to claim a clue adjacent to him.
{-} Doors are locked. When a Rebel figure enters a space adjacent to a door, if the heroes have collectively claimed 5 or more clues, open that door.
{-} The mission will progress when the Hideaway is revealed.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

{-} Place the heroes as close as possible to the blue highlighted space.
{-} Tiles not yet placed in the map are obscured tiles.
{-} When a Rebel figure enters a space that would be adjacent to a space on an obscured tile, click the respective highlight and select "Reveal".
{-} Rebel mission tokens represent clues. A hero can spend 1 movement point to claim a clue adjacent to him.
{-} Doors are locked. When a Rebel figure enters a space adjacent to a door, if the heroes have collectively claimed 5 or more clues, open that door.
{-} The mission will progress when the Hideaway is revealed.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.
Collect clues to reveal the Hideaway (Clues collected: &Clues&/5).

globalEvents.name: Detain Protesters
globalEvents.eventText:
Both sides try to secure their goals.

{-} Claim each protester that the Rebels control for the Rebels.
{-} Claim each protester that the Empire controls for the Empire.

globalEvents.name: Story 1
globalEvents.eventText:
The Empire decides to pursue the artifact directly.

{-} Place Story Mission card “Enemies Closer” into play.

globalEvents.name: Story 2
globalEvents.eventText:
The Empire still regards the Rebels as a threat and decides to try and sabotage their plans.

{-} Place Story Mission card “On the Run” into play.

globalEvents.name: Troopers Defeated
globalEvents.eventText:
As the last guard falls, the way to the terminal's data is free.

{-} A healthy hero can interact with the terminal to sabotage the Hideaway, ending the mission.

entityProperties.name: Terminal
entityProperties.theText:
The terminal contains data and records of Maul's and Zaaryn's transactions.

{-} A healthy hero can interact with the terminal to sabotage the Hideaway.

globalEvents.name: Claim Clue 1
globalEvents.eventText:
You gather all the evidence you can find.

{-} Claim this token.

globalEvents.name: Clues claimed
globalEvents.eventText:
You have found enough clues to deduce the location of the Hideaway and how to get there.

{-} When a Rebel figure enters a space adjacent to a door, open that door.

entityProperties.name: Hideaway Door 1
entityProperties.theText:
A closed door leads to some hidden place.

{-} When a Rebel figure enters a space adjacent to a door, open that door.

entityProperties.name: Hideaway Door 2
entityProperties.theText:
A closed door leads to some hidden place.

{-} When a Rebel figure enters a space adjacent to a door, open that door.

globalEvents.name: End Mission Hideaway Revealed
globalEvents.eventText: Because the Hideaway was revealed, the heroes receive 25 credits per hero.

globalEvents.name: Healthy Hero Yes
globalEvents.eventText: Increase the threat level of the next mission (and only the next mission) by 1. During the Rebel Upgrade stage, the Rebel players can decide to spend 50 credits per hero to prevent this.
